subject: Sleep
title: How Stages Were Classified
description: A quick win: understand How Stages Were Classified.

hook.text: In the 1960s, Allan Rechtschaffen and Anthony Kales published the bible of sleep staging. It ruled for decades.

buildup.text: Their system defined five stages: 1, 2, 3, 4, and REM, based on EEG wave patterns.

discovery.text: In 2007, the AASM merged stages 3 and 4 into one N3 stage, simplifying the system to four stages.

twist.text: The old stages 3 and 4 were nearly identical in brain waves. Separating them added complexity without value.

climax.text: Today's N1, N2, N3, and REM framework is the global standard used in every sleep lab worldwide.

punchline.text: Science simplified sleep from five stages to four.

quiz.question: Why were old stages 3 and 4 merged into N3?
options: They had nearly identical brain wave patterns
Nobody could tell them apart visually
